intro: Ocampoa acuminatissima, commonly known as the slender ocampoa, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in cool, temperate climates. Its narrow, grass-like leaves are arranged in a rosette pattern, and it produces small, yellowish to reddish flowers. Ocamoa acuminatissima is often found in montane ecosystems and is adapted to the harsh environmental conditions of its native habitat.
